value.title: Getting Started With Dataflow in Power BI   Creating Dataflow – Part 2 of Dataflow Series
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I mentioned what is the Dataflow, how it can be helpful, and mentioned some of the use cases of it in real-world Power BI implementation. In this video as the second part of the series for the Dataflow, I like to give you some hands-on experience with Dataflow and explain how a

value.title: How to Do Power BI Mapping With Latitude and Longitude Only
value.excerpt: You can just use latitude and longitude to visualize data on the map. In this video, you will learn how you can do that with the map visual in Power BI. Read more and download the dataset from my blog article link here: https://radacad.com/how-to-do-power-bi-mapping-with-latitude-and-longitude-only

value.title: How to modify a linked entity in Power BI dataflows
value.excerpt: It is not possible to change a linked entity in a dataflow in Power BI. Linked entities has to be modified only in the dataflow in which they are created. However, sometimes, you need to do a small modification to the linked entity in a chained dataflow. There is a very simple trick, In this article
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/E1vGsjAZ0VQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to solve Inactive Relationship Problem with Role Playing Dimensions in Power BI
value.excerpt: Role-Playing Dimension is one way of solving the inactive relationship problem in Power BI. Download the dataset for this example from my blog article here:  https://radacad.com/userelationship-or-role-playing-dimension-dealing-with-inactive-relationships-in-power-bi

value.title: Microsoft Power BI: Unleash row level security patterns in Power BI - THR3015
value.excerpt: Security is different from sharing; sharing is about sharing the entire content with others—security is about authorizing different views of the content to others. In this session we go through many different Row Level Security patterns; Static Row Level Security, Dynamic Row Level Security, and many
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dGpX8-4adkY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Performance Tip for Power BI Enable Load Sucks Memory Up
value.excerpt: In the area of performance tuning a Power BI model, many things have to be considered, most of them around the consumption of the CPU and RAM. One of the most basic but important consideration is minimizing the usage of memory. By default, all queries from Query Editor will be loaded into the memory

value.title: Replace BLANK with Zero in Power BI Visuals Such as Card
value.excerpt: If you use a field in a visual and based on a combination of slicer selection, that field doesn't have any value, you might see blank in the visual. If you want to replace that blank to zero, here is a trick for you. a very simple trick that you can use anywhere easily. Read more details in my blog post,

value.title: Set Different Levels of Access on the Same Dataset in Power BI using Row Level Security
value.excerpt: Learn how to set different levels of access to the users of the same report and same dataset in Power BI using Row Level Security. The dataset link is available in my blog post here:  https://radacad.com/row-level-security-configuration-in-power-bi-desktop

value.title: What are the Use Cases of Dataflow for You in Power BI
value.excerpt: There have been lots of announcements about Dataflow online, through videos and articles and news. There are many demos about Dataflow as well. However, still when I talk about it in conferences, one of the main questions from the audience is that; “What are use cases for it?”. In this video, I’m going

value.title: What Do You Need to Implement Dynamic Row Level Security in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have explained in some videos about the RLS topic already. Through my consulting experience, however, I get the feeling that many people can’t easily move from static RLS to dynamic. If you know what are things you need to have the dynamic RLS implemented, it makes the whole process simple. So this

value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Analyzing a slow report query in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Investigate a slow query in a Power BI report using DAX Studio, looking at the query plan and the server timings. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ Optimizing DAX Workshop: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/optimizing-dax-video-course/

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/YtIdcCYnZ9w" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Creating a calculated table with DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to write and test the expression for a calculated table in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yZnl2P9ik9g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: How to debug a DAX measure
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to run and debug a DAX measure: fix a calculation issue in a more productive environment and then copy the right formula back in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ VertiPaq Analyzer: https://www.sqlbi.com/tools/vertipaq-analyzer/

value.title: Introducing DEFINE TABLE in DAX queries
value.excerpt: Learn the syntax and the use cases of the DEFINE TABLE statement in DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/696241/?aff=yt This syntax has been introduced in DAX since December 2020 and can be used in DAX queries only.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide

value.title: Previous year up to a certain date
value.excerpt: This video describes how to compute previous year values up to a certain date in DAX and Power BI. This technique is useful in case the data is presenting incomplete months or years. value.title: Using calculation groups to switch between different dates
value.excerpt: Use calculation groups to change the active relationship in a model in order to let users choose among multiple dates in a Power BI report. Article and download: https://sql.bi/684295?aff=yt

value.title: Using USERELATIONSHIP in DAX

value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You’ll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you’ll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Analyze collaboration and engagement using the Workplace Analytics Ways of working assessment dashboard
value.excerpt: Learn to evaluate collaboration culture and employee experience with a Power BI template using Workplace Analytics data.

value.title: Create a Power BI Dashboard in 10 Minutes!

value.title: 2 ways to create a radial bar chart in  Power BI
